definition: Prefer candidates that cover primitives currently underrepresented in the deck.
how_to_compute: For candidate C, score = sum_{p in primitives(C)} 1/(1+deck_count(p)). Use only primitives relevant to the active need bucket.
notes: Does not use popularity or meta. Works even in closed-world without external stats.
selection_rule: Reserve K_offbeat slots per need bucket for highest NP_OFFBEAT_SCORE (tie-break by oracle_id).
why_it_matters: Ensures niche bridging cards survive pruning.

definition: Prefer candidates that connect multiple engine/structure needs (role compression + multi-primitive).
how_to_compute: Bridge score = (#distinct structural roles satisfied by C) + (#primary_motif_primitives covered by C).
notes: Encourages role-compressed glue cards and synergy bridges.
selection_rule: Reserve K_bridge slots per need bucket for highest bridge score.
why_it_matters: Improves deck coherence and reduces dead draws.

definition: Prefer candidates that improve curve / early playability when needed.
how_to_compute: Low curve score = 1 if mv<=2 else 0.5 if mv==3 else 0.0, adjusted by fixing compatibility.
selection_rule: Reserve K_low_curve slots when profile indicates curve risk or ramp miss.
why_it_matters: Prevents slow builds that die before engines start.
